body:
@dragotin client or server error? thx

-------- ursprã¼ngliche nachricht --------
von: liezie <notifications@github.com> 
datum:  
an: owncloud/core <core@noreply.github.com> 
betreff: [core] csync update failed (client 1.1.4 server 4.5.4) (#1200) 
 
i can't get the sync working. i keep getting this csync error on the client.

client: 1.1.4 on windows 7 (tested from 2 pc's)

server:
windows 2003 - iis 7 - oc 4.5.4

i know the client is ok, because it works with the oc demo.
i know the website, file-rights and user are ok, because via the browser i can access, download and upload files.

i tried the usual: reinstall, different version, restart iis, different folders, other user, ...
i tried installing the webdav on iis but this didn't resolve the issue.

when i start the client with the --logwindow option:

help?

extra info

i first logged this on owncloud but was refered to the mirall section. logged a new ticket there (owncloud/mirall#196) and was refered to this section (core).

relevant comments on that ticket were: 
1/ dragotin commented 2 hours ago
this is the key log line:
12-19 18:58:59:772 csync.updater - opendir failed for owncloud://owncloud.edesk.be/remote.php/webdav/clientsync - file exists (errno 17)
note to self: windows iis 7

thanks for pushing me onto this! indeed the errno 17 is plain wrong. your server returns a http status code 405 which means method not allowed as reply on a propfind request from the owncloud client. it seems that your iis installation is somehow not correctly configured for owncloud here.

when i asked which iis configuration to check , i was told to post the bug here, in the core.

â€”
reply to this email directly or view it on github.
@deepdiver1975 : i think its a server misconfiguration (note its iis) - as the server replies to a propfind with 405 which is *method not allowed*

so i googled for and found this: http://forums.iis.net/t/1183163.aspx/1

checked my applicationhost.config and it contains this line:
( handlers accesspolicy="read, script" )
                 (add name="webdav" path="*" verb="propfind,proppatch,mkcol,put,copy,delete,move,lock,unlock" modules="webdavmodule" resourcetype="unspecified" requireaccess="none" / )
... 
(* changed brackets because the editor removed them) 
seems ok.
not enabling all verbs seems to be a quite common mistake, it should probably be added to the server notes...
